author: .vbuterin
content: To be clear I'm not advocating for stateless block production on anything less than a 5 year timescale

author: .vbuterin
content: > How do we deal with the fact that stateless clients don't have witnesses to validate txs, so the gossiping could be filled with invalid txs

author: .vbuterin
content: The idea I had for this is that every client would always make sure they have at least one peer who is state-carrying, and they would broadcast any transaction to a state-carrying peer first. The state-carrying peer would attach the witness, and then the transaction could be broadcasted and verified by state-carrying and non-state-carrying peers like from there

author: .vbuterin
content: > Is there a risk that block producers will actually only hold the most profitable part of the state?

author: .vbuterin
content: Doesn't that risk already exist today?

author: .vbuterin
content: ah I guess the one thing that changes is that you would be able to verify blocks without state

author: .vbuterin
content: But if you don't hold full state you would be vulnerable to dao-soft-fork-style DoS
